title: Newtons third law-forces on box on surface

content.question: A box is pulled to the right with constant speed across a rough horizontal surface. The box is subject to the four forces shown in the diagram: a tension force <math alttext="F sub T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>T</mi></msub></math>, a friction force <math alttext="F sub lowercase f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>, a normal force <math alttext="F sub N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>N</mi></msub></math>, and a gravitational force <math alttext="F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math>. Which of the following pair of these forces, if any, represents an interacting force pair described by Newtonâ€™s third law?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>N</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub lowercase f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>

<math alttext="F sub T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>T</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub lowercase f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>

<math alttext="F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>N</mi></msub></math>
None of the four forces are an interacting force pair because all four forces are exerted on the same object.

content.answer: None of the four forces are an interacting force pair because all four forces are exerted on the same object.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
